ticket.title: End-to-end integration tests for economics-gated projection pipeline

tickets.reason: Gate wiring must be complete before end-to-end tests can exercise the full pipeline.
Deferred replay worker must be complete before outage-recovery scenarios can be tested.

in_scope: End-to-end test: ledger event -> economics gate evaluation -> PCAC lifecycle (join, revalidate, consume) -> projection ALLOW -> GitHub adapter call -> admission receipt with lifecycle artifacts recorded in intent buffer.
End-to-end test: ledger event -> economics gate evaluation -> projection DENY (stale temporal authority) -> intent buffered -> no adapter call.
End-to-end test: ledger event -> DENY (missing continuity profile) -> intent buffered -> fail-closed verified.
Lifecycle denial test: ledger event -> economics ALLOW -> revalidation detects revoked authority -> DENY -> no adapter call -> deny receipt records lifecycle denial reason.
Lifecycle denial test: ledger event -> economics ALLOW -> consume detects already-consumed token -> DENY -> no adapter call -> replay prevention verified.
Lifecycle denial test: ledger event -> economics ALLOW -> revalidation detects stale authority (freshness check) -> DENY -> no adapter call.
Outage scenario test: N intents buffered during simulated sink outage -> sink recovery -> deferred replay drains in order -> convergence receipt emitted.
Outage + revocation scenario: intent buffered during outage -> authority revoked during outage -> replay DENY despite economics ALLOW -> deny receipt records revocation.
Window expiration scenario: intent buffered -> tick advances past replay window -> intent expired with deny receipt on replay attempt.
Idempotency scenario: same (work_id, changeset_digest) projected twice -> second is no-op (consumed-token enforced).
All tests use mock ProjectionAdapter (no real GitHub calls) and deterministic HTF ticks.
out_of_scope: Live GitHub integration tests (those belong in a separate smoke-test suite).
Multi-sink scenario tests (single GitHub sink only).

steps: Implement MockProjectionAdapter that records calls and can simulate failures.
Implement test harness: in-memory SQLite, ConfigBackedResolver with test profiles, deterministic tick source.
Write happy-path e2e test: event -> gate ALLOW -> lifecycle ALLOW -> project -> receipt with lifecycle artifacts.
Write deny-path e2e tests: stale authority, missing profile, missing snapshot.
Write lifecycle-denial e2e tests: revoked authority after economics ALLOW, stale authority at revalidation, consumed token.
Write outage-recovery test: buffer during outage, replay on recovery, verify order and receipts.
Write outage+revocation test: buffer during outage, revoke authority, verify replay DENY.
Write window-expiration test: buffer, advance past window, verify expiration.
Write idempotency test: project same intent twice, verify single adapter call.

criteria: All e2e scenarios pass with deterministic fixtures (no flaky timing).
Happy path verifies: gate called, lifecycle enforced (join+revalidate+consume), adapter called, receipt with lifecycle artifact references recorded, intent admitted.
Deny paths verify: gate called, adapter NOT called, intent denied with reason, no projection side effects.
Lifecycle denial paths verify: economics ALLOW followed by lifecycle DENY (revoked/stale/consumed) -> adapter NOT called, deny receipt records lifecycle denial subcategory.
Outage recovery verifies: correct replay order, convergence receipt, backlog_digest correctness.
Outage+revocation verifies: replayed intent with revoked authority denied despite economics ALLOW.
No test uses real network I/O — all adapter interactions are mocked.

notes.security:
These tests are the binding evidence that fail-closed semantics hold end-to-end.
Every deny scenario must assert both that projection did NOT occur AND that the
deny reason was recorded. Silent deny (no receipt) is itself a defect.

PCAC LIFECYCLE TESTS ARE MANDATORY: The lifecycle denial tests (revoked authority,
stale authority, consumed token) are the binding evidence that economics ALLOW alone
cannot authorize a projection. Without these tests, an attacker can exploit the gap
between economics admission and authority validity to execute unauthorized projections.
notes.verification:
Test fixtures must cover all ContinuityDecision::Deny variants from the economics
module to ensure no deny path is untested at the integration level.
Additionally, test fixtures must cover all lifecycle denial variants:
(1) authority revoked between economics check and effect,
(2) authority stale at revalidation time,
(3) token already consumed through alternate path,
(4) replayed intent with revoked authority after outage.
notes.general:
This ticket is the capstone — it proves the integration works as a system,
not just as individual components. It should be the last ticket executed in
this wave.
